title.rendered: Find Rooms For Rent In Hartford

content.rendered:
Which food joints serve up the best food? How do you get to work? Where can you find rooms for rent in Hartford? Roomi’s city guide for Hartford answers all these questions and more!

Getting to Know Hartford

Connecticut’s capital city is not just home to some of the top-rated colleges but has plenty of job opportunities, and a low cost of living compared to the rest of the state. Hartford has several historical sites, such as the nation’s first Rose Garden, and the oldest public art museum.

With this city guide for Hartford, you’ll be able to blend in with the residents in no time!

Related: Finding Professional Growth In 2021

Finding rooms for rent in Hartford

Find A Room In Hartford

Living in Connecticut is expensive, and even though living costs in Hartford may be cheaper than the rest of the state, it is still 17% higher than the national average. However, finding rooms for rent in Hartford is easy as most people prefer to rent their homes before settling down.

Related: How to Resolve Conflicts When You Share an Apartment

Top neighborhoods in Hartford

  • West End: Looking for rooms for rent in Hartford that entertainment options and a host of other amenities? Look no further than West End! Home to the University of Connecticut School of Law, you will find some famous food joints here like Mo’s Midtown and Whitney Pizza.
  • Downtown: One of the most walkable neighborhoods in the city, Downtown Hartford is perfect for singles and young professionals. Not only are you close to entertainment options and trendy bars, but they’re also all within walking distance!
  • Sheldon Charter Oak: the perfect neighborhood for families who want to be close to entertainment options but want plenty of space for their kids to play around in. it is not only home to plenty of eateries but to Colt Park as well, which sprawls across 107-acres of greenery! But, keep in mind that the rooms are a little more expensive here than the average rent in Hartford.

Average rent in Hartford

University life in Hartford

Hartford is home to a number of prestigious colleges, which is one of the main reasons people move to the city every year. When you start your university life in Hartford, you won’t feel like a newbie.

When you live close to your university campus, the city can seem like a college town, with plenty of events taking place every evening.

Looking to attend universities in the city? Here are some that you should check out.

  • Trinity College
  • University of Hartford
  • University of Connecticut-Hartford Campus
  • University of Connecticut School of Law

Related: Roommate Bonding Activities To Do While Living With A Roommate

How transit friendly is Hartford?

While most people prefer to have their own ride, you can get around Hartford even without owning a car. Public transit is used by commuters frequently, with a few preferring to walk or bike to their destination. You’ll have plenty of ways to explore the city.

Related: 5 Best Places in Connecticut to Visit

1. Walkability

Hartford has decent walkability with a walk score of 71, with the most walkable neighborhoods being Downtown Hartford, Frog Hollow, and South Green. If you like taking an evening stroll around the neighborhood, try snagging rooms for rent in these Hartford neighborhoods!

2. Roads/traffic

On average, a one-way commute in Hartford takes about 23 minutes, which is much shorter than the national average. Most people prefer to drive around the city, but plenty of people also opt for public transportation to get to and from work. Don’t prefer either? You can always hitch a ride via carpooling options!

3. Taxis

Apart from Uber and Lyft, there are various taxi services in the city, with a few companies offering dedicated services for rides to and from the airport. Typically, the base fare for taxi services is $2.60, with an additional $2.70 per mile and a waiting fee of $0.50 per minute.

4. Public transportation

Hartford residents have plenty of public transportation options, whether they want to get around the city or travel outside. CT Transit provides several bus routes throughout the city, and you can get two-hour tickets or all-day passes. The CTFastrak is a rapid bus transportation system that operates on bus-only roads and connects Hartford to New Britain, making several stops along the way. Want to get around Downtown? Catch a ride for free on the Hartford Dash Shuttle that operates every 15-minutes in the downtown area during the weekdays.

The New Haven-Hartford-Springfield Rail Program makes it easier for residents to get to New Haven or Springfield. You can also hop on the Amtrak or CTrail, from Hartford’s Union Station to get to Boston or New York.

5. Airports

Located near Windsor Locks, the Bradley International Airport is the closes airport near the city. You can cover the 15-mile distance by driving along with the 1-91 or hop on the CT Transit Bus 30.

6. Cycling

Currently, the city aims to connect a bicycle network throughout the city to help make the roads safer for cyclists. The BiCi Co is a widely used bike-sharing program in the city to rent bikes, helmets, and more. Try it out at reasonable prices or become a member.

Restaurants in Hartford

Looking for your next favorite dish? Hartford eateries are famous for their delectable food, and once you grab a bite, you won’t be able to get enough of it!

  • Carbone’s: family-owned restaurant serving up delicious Italian cuisine and ice-creams!
  • City Steam and Brewery: grab some classic American dishes and delicious brews.
  • Max’s Oyster Bar: explore local seafood favorites.

Cultural Activities in Hartford

Wondering what you can do while you’re in Hartford? Take a trip to the Wadsworth Atheneum Museum of Art, the nation’s oldest public art museum, or learn some interesting facts about our planet at the Connecticut Science Center. If you’re a history buff, you will love visiting the Museum of Connecticut History.

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find rooms for rent in Hartford? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match! 

DOWNLOAD THE APP NOW!
